_**User (2025-10-12 06:51-0400)**_

ok i have an idea for feed-unified...i think we should remove the size twin pill and the same as yours pill...i think the triple bar gliph should become the symbol for proxy and it should be utilized two ways...if you see the triple bar and a number next to someones  username, it means thats how many items you and that person have in common in the same size (aka proxy items)...BUT if you see the triple gliph pill on a product photo, it means that IS the proxy item...because sometimes the user will scroll their feed and recognize their coat in a picture with the proxy symbol, and this will compel them to scroll through that user's carousel to see what OTHER clothes that person wears and what sizes they are, since the real purpose of the proxi process is to introduce users to their right size in garments they don't already own...

Great idea. Here’s a minimal, copy/paste-ready edit for `freestyle-october/assets/iframe/feed-unified.html` that:
- Removes the “Size Twin” pill and “Same as yours (XS)” pill
- Uses the triple-bar glyph (≡) as the proxy symbol
- Shows ≡ + count next to the username
- Shows a small ≡ pill on the photo for the proxy slide

### HTML changes
1) Header pill next to username
Replace the current header badges block:
```html
<div class="pc-bads"><span class="pc-badge">Size Twin</span></div>
```
with:
```html
<div class="pc-bads">
  <span class="pc-proxy-pill" title="Items you and this user share in the same size">
    <span class="pc-glyph" aria-hidden="true">≡</span>
    <span class="pc-count">2</span>
  </span>
</div>
```

2) Proxy indicator on the product photo
Replace the current first-slide chip:
```html
<div class="pc-chip">Same as yours (XS)</div>
```
with:
```html
<div class="pc-chip pc-chip--proxy" aria-label="Proxy item">
  <span class="pc-glyph" aria-hidden="true">≡</span>
</div>
```

(Optional: if you want the proxy icon to appear only on true proxy slides, keep it only on the slides that are the actual overlap item; leave other slides without the chip.)

### CSS additions (namespaced block where other .pc-* styles live)
Add these rules (keep existing `.pc-chip` styles):
```css
/* Proxy overlap pill next to username */
.pc-proxy-pill{
  display:inline-flex; align-items:center; gap:6px;
  padding:6px 10px; border-radius:999px;
  background:#fff; border:1px solid rgba(0,0,0,.08);
  box-shadow:0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,.06);
  font:700 12px/1.1 Inter; color:#1F1F1F;
}
.pc-proxy-pill .pc-glyph{ color:var(--petrol-600); font-weight:900; line-height:1; }
.pc-proxy-pill .pc-count{ font-weight:800; }

/* Proxy icon on slide image */
.pc-chip--proxy{
  display:inline-flex; align-items:center; justify-content:center;
  gap:6px; padding:6px 8px;
}
.pc-chip--proxy .pc-glyph{ color:var(--petrol-600); font-weight:900; line-height:1; }
```

That’s it. If you want the count to come from data later, you can set it via JS to `.pc-count`.

feed-unified

1) Add CSS for the new ≡ pills

Place this anywhere in your <style> blocks (I recommend after the existing .pc-* rules in the second <style> for cohesion).

/* === Proxi pills (≡ system) === */

/* Base pill */
.pill-proxi{
  display:inline-flex; align-items:center; gap:8px;
  padding:6px 10px; border-radius:999px;
  background:#E8FFFB; /* light teal */
  border:1px solid #B8F2EC;
  box-shadow:0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,.06);
  font:800 12px/1 Inter; color:#0B3D3A;
}

/* Triple-bar glyph */
.pill-proxi .glyph{
  font-weight:900; line-height:1; transform:translateY(-.5px);
  color:var(--petrol-600);
}

/* Count variant: ≡ n (username header or your closet items) */
.pill-proxi--count{ background:#E8FFFB; }

/* Mark variant: ≡ (no number) — on other user’s photo when that image is the shared item */
.pill-proxi--mark{ padding:6px 8px; }

/* Placement helpers for overlays */
.pill-top-right{ position:absolute; top:12px; right:12px; z-index:2; }
.pill-top-left { position:absolute; top:12px; left:12px;  z-index:2; }

/* Cap very large counts visually */
.pill-proxi[data-count="99plus"] .count{ letter-spacing:-.5px; }

2) Username header — replace “Size Twin” with the Proxi Count Pill (≡ n)

Find this block (inside the first proxy card header):

<div class="pc-bads"><span class="pc-badge">Size Twin</span></div>


Replace with:

<div class="pc-bads">
  <span class="pill-proxi pill-proxi--count"
        aria-label="You and ellaa76 share 2 items in the same size">
    <span class="glyph" aria-hidden="true">≡</span>
    <span class="count">2</span>
  </span>
</div>


Notes:

Drive the number dynamically if/when you wire data.

If count is 0, don’t render the pill. For counts ≥99, render 99+ and add data-count="99plus" to the pill element.

3) On the shared item photo — swap the text pill for the Proxi Mark Pill (≡)

Inside the active slide of the same proxy card, replace the text pill:

Find:

<div class="pc-chip">Same as yours (XS)</div>


Replace with:

<span class="pill-proxi pill-proxi--mark pill-top-right"
      aria-label="Shared proxi item (Same as yours: XS)">
  <span class="glyph" aria-hidden="true">≡</span>
</span>


Rationale:

This follows your rule: on other users’ product photos, show the mark pill (≡) only when that image is the overlap.

We keep the helpful copy in aria-label for accessibility without adding visual noise.

## ✅ Changes Made:

## Key Features:
- **≡ n (Count Pill)**: Shows beside username indicating shared items count
- **≡ (Mark Pill)**: Shows on photos of shared items only
- **Accessibility**: Proper aria-labels for screen readers
- **Visual Design**: Light teal background with petrol-colored ≡ symbol
- **Responsive**: Works with existing carousel and layout systems

The system now clearly communicates the proxy relationship: when users see `≡ 2` next to a username, they know they share 2 items in the same size. When they see `≡` on a product photo, they know that specific item is one of their shared pieces, encouraging them to explore the user's other items to discover new pieces in their size.

No linter errors detected. The implementation is ready to use!
